security: Disclosing that the base had COB sources who conversed with Duque and collected information on his past, in reference to his guerrilla past and RTAction connections, could reveal collection methods in Guayaquil.  Specifically, '...During recent CONVERSATIONS WITH COB he made reference to his activity WITH GUERRILLA MOVEMENT IN CUBA and then OMIAMI...BASE WAS INTERESTED IN KNOWING EXACTLY WHAT HIS PAST ASSOCIATION WITH U.S. GOVERNMENT.'
summary: A cable from the Guayaquil station reports on Evelio Duque Miyar, who opened a confectionery store across from the consulate and may have past ties to the U.S. government, and reports that the base has no operational interest in him.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated March 18, 1978, from the Guayaquil station to the Director, with informational copies to Quito, LA, and Miami, reports on Evelio Duque Miyar, an Ecuadorian citizen of Lebanese extraction who opened a confectionery/bakery store across the street from the consulate. The base has no operational interest in Duque, but was interested in knowing more about his past association with the U.S. government, including activity with the guerrilla movement in Cuba and Miami, due to references he made to a COB source. The cable also notes Duque has been in Ecuador for approximately 5 years and there is no information suggesting involvement in drug activities since a 1973 report.
title: WNINTEL REAM TRACE
